828967236:
[

Director, MBA Program (Associate Professor)

Company Name La Trobe University Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 74 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Leadership of our top-ranked MBA Program
  • Continuing, full time position based at the Melbourne (Bundoora) campus
  • $135,347 - $148,959 per annum plus up to 17% superannuation

About La Trobe


La Trobe University’s success is driven by people who are committed to making a difference. They are creative and highly motivated, pursue new ideas and create knowledge. La Trobe is one of Australia’s research leaders, and the largest provider of higher education to regional Victoria. La Trobe University turned 50 in 2017, and over the half century of its existence it has established a reputation as an innovative and accessible university, willing to take risks and take on challenges.\xa0 Our teaching and research address some of the most significant issues of our time and we’re passionate about driving change through operational excellence to benefit the communities we serve.


The La Trobe Business School (LBS) is committed to excellence in business education and research in order to make a difference to our students and other stakeholders. We do this through innovation, strong engagement with all our business and other stakeholders and an emphasis on responsible management practice.\xa0 The MBA is a flagship program for the university. It is a multi-disciplinary program with contributions from each of the four departments. The La Trobe MBA aims to prepare working professionals for their career aspirations and the emerging challenges of the 21st century.


\xa0


About the role


The MBA is delivered at our Melbourne CBD Collins Street premises, with simultaneous delivery to regional campus locations. Selected subjects are also delivered by block mode at regional campus locations, and the MBA is also delivered at Hanoi University, Vietnam. The Director will be supported by a Deputy Director who has responsibility to manage and develop the online version of the MBA.


The primary responsibility of the position is to represent LBS, the College and the University internally and externally, and provide leadership in the MBA on behalf of LBS.


The successful incumbent will lead the promotion of the MBA in domestic and international markets, manage the delivery and continuous development of the MBA program, and deliver a multi-campus MBA using technology and flexible modes of delivery. \xa0Your success will be reflected in the external image, ranking and accreditation of the MBA, growth in student and employer satisfaction.


\xa0


Skills & Experience


To be considered for this role you will possess a PhD in Business (or a relevant area).\xa0 You will also be able to demonstrate leadership and capacity for innovation in curriculum development and teaching post graduate students.


You will have a demonstrated capacity for attracting and supervising Honours and Higher Degree by Research (HDR) candidates and a successful track record of attracting research funding through grants, contracts or consultancies.


Evidence of strategic capability and marketing within the context of recruiting and retaining domestic and international students will be required, as will strong links with the business community, apparent in your ability to source external funding through collaboration, grants contracts and consultancies.


All La Trobe University employees are bound by the Working with Children Act 2005.\xa0 If you are successful, you will be required to hold a valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check prior to commencement.

Company Name City of Greater Dandenong Company Location Dandenong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Band 4, $61,600 pa

Permanent Full Time

The City of Greater Dandenong is an organisation of exceptional character. We invest in the development of our people and the community and we strive to be a workplace that is respectful, engaged, accountable, creative and honest. We are a progressive organisation, in a city that is on the move and we offer a dynamic and rewarding work environment.

We offer exceptional working conditions and are focused on providing a workplace that values diverse contributions, cares for your health and wellbeing and fosters a positive work culture. We ensure all people have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement within our organisation.

We embrace our diverse community and work environment and encourage applications from everyone including people of Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander background, people of diverse sexual orientation and gender, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and people of varied age, ability, and faith. Council will give due consideration to any workplace adjustments to accommodate the needs of any prospective or existing staff member.

We are seeking a person who is a well-organised administration and customer service professional who thrives in an environment of multiple tasks, tight deadlines and regular interaction with internal staff, external stakeholders and customers.

If you are passionate about providing high level administration support and customer service then we have a fantastic role for you in our Planning and Design Department, where you will be supported to achieve your best and thrive in a collaborative and innovative team environment.

As Planning Support Officer you will play an integral role in providing exceptional administrative and technical support and of the Planning & Design Department. Additionally you will provide professional advice and contribution to the continuous improvement of the unit.

The Planning & Design Administration Support Officer Will
  • Provide and maintain an effective and efficient administrative system for the processing of Planning Applications, Scheme Amendments and other related matters and assist in the achievement of team targets
  • Utilise database systems for timely management and tracking of Planning & Design data along with software or systems updates from suppliers or Information Management Services (IMS)
  • Deliver high levels of customer service to external clients and the general public to support effective and efficient Planning & Design operations in person, by email and on the telephone
Applicants must adequately meet the requirements of the role and fully address the selection criteria contained in the position description. To view a copy of this position description, please click on the link below.

You may be required to undertake work preference profiling / psychometric testing.

We offer a range of benefits for staff including a friendly team environment, salary sacrificed child care (where available), discounted gym membership and a vibrant social club.

Further information: Will Stewart, 8571 1526

Applications close: 5pm, Friday, 7 September 2018

835056901:
[

Systems and Devops Engineer - VIC

Company Name Greencap Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Exciting permanent opportunity with 2+ years’ experience in DevOps & cloud technologies

  • Must have strong Linux Server Admin and AWS skills

  • Join the largest Risk Management Company based at Head Office in Kew, VIC


Greencap is the largest integrated risk management and compliance company in Australia and New Zealand delivering Work Health and Safety, Property and Environmental risk management solutions.Greencap service thousands of private and government clients in the education, property, resources, industrial, manufacturing, retail and services sectors.Greencap partners with clients to understand their needs, allowing us to deliver tailored risk management solutions that protect our client’s most valued assets; their People, Property and Environment.


With over 300 professional, technical and engineering employees based in 9 offices across Australia and New Zealand, we are now seeking a highly driven and experienced Systems and DevOps Engineer to join our Product and Technology team based at our Head Office in Kew, VIC.


The Role:


Reporting to the National IT Manager, the Systems/DevOps Engineer will be responsible for supporting existing solutions as well as building new solutions. This role will be instrumental in managing our systems and uplift of the DevOps function. You will lead IT project and Initiatives from time to time as needed, be involved in the support process for internal systems when escalated or when required.


Key responsibilities:


Your current or previous experience working within an Agile delivery within complex technology operating environments will guarantee a quick transition into this role coupled with solid experience with server administration for Linux and/or Windows environments and scripting skills in Bash, Powershell, Python. Your responsibilities will be as follows, but not limited to:



  • Supporting Windows operations and existing infrastructure.

  • Automate infrastructure and deployment through code.

  • IT environment performance monitoring and reporting.

  • Adopt a code-first approach to infrastructure management.

  • Develop, maintain the CI/Cd environment.

  • Documenting practices, solutions, known issues, and common troubleshooting procedures.

  • Look for ways to optimize and enhance current processes.

  • Ensure all systems, platforms and applications are compliant with and operating to relevant security and data protection standards.

  • Work with development team to provide scalability and availability of services.

  • Providing technical assistance and information to other team members.


Ideally you have the following skills and attributes:



  • Exposure to Cloud, AWS, DevOps and On-prem infrastructure and services.

  • Demonstrated hands on experience in DevOps and automation frameworks across delivery life cycle (deployment, infrastructure, testing).

  • 2 to 4 years of environment management and software configuration experience within complex technology operating environments.

  • Linux experience.

  • Good Database knowledge (MYSQL & MSSQL).

  • CI/CD pipeline skills (e.g. Bitbucket, Git, Code build and deploy)

  • Windows Server 2008/2012 in a Hyper-V environment.

  • Understanding of Active directory, GPO, DHCP and DNS.

  • Experience with scripting languages: Bash, Powershell, Python.

  • Sound experience around Continuous Integration and Delivery concepts and use of toolsets such as Jenkins, Gitlab, GIT,JIRA, Confluence.

  • Understanding of Docker and Virtual Machines.


Technical skills are important, however they are not everything. We see our culture just as important and therefore the candidate will have:



  • An ability to lead, resolve and take ownership of tasks and knowing when to escalate.

  • Desire and capability to listen, analyse and act (take initiative).

  • Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated skills in handling difficult customer situations.

  • Good time management and organisation skills.


What we offer You:



  • A great career within Greencap, a division of our highly regarded ASX Top 20 Wesfarmers parent company!

  • A career building opportunity and support provided to you to enhance your skills, professional development and achieve the success you desire!

  • Access to structured training and development opportunities

  • Flexible work environment within a strong team and collegial inclusive culture.

  • A competitive salary package commensurate with your capability and experience

  • Participation in Wesfarmers share plan and range of other employee benefits!


We are on the cusp of an ambitious growth and change phase. It’s an exciting time to build your career with Greencap!


Click the ‘Apply’ button below and follow the links to submit your covering letter and CV. To apply you must be an Australian/New Zealand resident orable to work without restriction in Australia.


Applications close: Sunday, 16 September 2018



WIS promotes and adheres to the principles and practices of diversity

Overview

Supporting the sub-regional General Manager of Quest Software in achieving business objectives through customer, operational and business support. Responsible for serving as primary interface between sales and other operational functions developing sales processes and procedures and communication. Evaluates and implements improvements to sales programs and processes with key responsibilities including business planning, sales operations, pipeline and forecast, performance management, KPIs, planning and prioritization, pricing and margin strategies, sales automation, tools and reporting programs.

Responsibilities

Principal Accountabilities
  • Business planning
    • Support sub-region leader in business planning and analysis to deliver sales quota
    • Managing all aspects of sales operations in sub region including target setting, commissions support, forecasting, analysis and senior management decision support, identification of commercial risks and implementation of initiatives to mitigate as well as using globally deployed policies and tools
    • Sales capacity planning, including sales compensation plan, quota deployment, account roster
    • Sales productivity and performance analysis, headcount analysis, and Opex management
    • Understanding strategic goals of each business unit and working with them for solutions and tools to enable sales
    • Assisting the business to identify key issues in the area of operations and help align and drive required actions
    • Drive key initiatives for mid to long term growth

  • Facilitates product and sales information flow
  • Drives sales operations process improvements
  • May serve as primary interfaces with other internal functions, based on BU and/or regional requirements
  • May be responsible for influencing sales behaviour and capabilities

Trainee Electrical Project Manager

Company Name POWERPLANT Project Services Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Role: \xa0 Trainee Electrical Project Manager


POWERPLANT is an established, expert, and award-winning Design and Project Management Consultancy in the Utilities Industry. The company has a highly skilled, responsive and engaged team of specialists providing customers including Infrastructure Owners, Electrical Utilities, VicRoads, Councils and Land Developers with Design and Project Management Services. POWERPLANT has been in business for 20 years and has become the leading independent utility infrastructure specialist in Victoria. The business is poised to play a leading role in exciting, rewarding, and industry changing initiatives.


Initially based in Hallam, with the option of an Altona North office available within the financial year, the Trainee Project Manager is part of the URD Delivery Team and reports to the Manager, URD Delivery. The role demands an enthusiastic, achievement focused individual who, like us, values People, Performance, and Pride in everything they do. Through training and ongoing support from experienced industry practitioners, the role will ultimately be responsible for management of the compliance process relating to construction of electrical networks in new underground residential estates.




Duties:

  • Undertake training and ongoing mentoring from experienced practitioners to provide Project Management Services for URD estates, in accordance with all business, client, and Network requirements, to achieve project completion, and achievement of Statement of Compliance, as early as possible;
  • Proactively manage customers and stakeholders such as utilities, developers, consultants and contractors;
  • Perform project related risk identification and mitigation plans;
  • Provide reporting and advice to customers to manage expectations and deliver a quality product.


Responsibilities:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

  • Take direction from Accredited Project Managers on the steps required to complete the PM2/PMC function;
  • Effectively manage time to ensure priorities are met;
  • Engage in professional communication, both written and verbal, with internal and external stakeholders;
  • Maintain a high level of organisation to manage information and requirements across multiple projects.


Equipment supplied:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

  • Access to a company vehicle for work related travel.
  • Full PPE including boots will be provided.
  • Phone will be provided for work purposes.
  • Laptop will be provided to allow work away from the office.


Future Opportunities:\xa0

  • Accreditation as Electrical PM (PM2/PMC) with Powercor and AusNet Services


To be successful in this role you will need to display the following skills and attributes:

  • Ability to work constructively within a high performing team environment
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Be focused on delivering results safely, effectively, and economically
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Commercial awareness
  • Strong customer orientation and customer service experience
  • Strong analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills
  • Excellent time management and scheduling skills
  • Experience in reading and interpreting electrical design plans will be highly regarded

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

Further information is available by contacting our Hallam Office on (03) 8786 1666.

Applications should be made electronically to info@powerplant.com.au \xa0


If you would like to discuss this opportunity on a confidential basis please contact Mr. Simon Priest General Manager Delivery on (03) 8786 1666.

[

Business Development Executive

Company Name WorldStrides Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 56 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Passionate about education and travel?\xa0


Eager to share your passion with teachers and educators?


About us


WorldStrides is dedicated to delivering educational travel experiences that fuel dreams for students of all ages. Our educational travel programs immerse students in knowledge culture and undeniable inspiration. WorldStrides has shaped the minds of students through educational travel since 1967 and each year over 400,000 students travel to more than 95 countries on our programs.


The role


We are looking for competitive and self-motivated sales professionals to represent a product that can change people's lives! The Business Development Executive (BDE) is responsible for achieving sales goals through the sale of educational tours to Australian schools. Each BDE is required to maintain competitive sales numbers and will be responsible for finding prospective clients both within the existing databases and through additional activities.


Responsibilities


  • Solicit new clients and accounts through sales calls and follow up and convert potential sales leads
  • Maintain relationships with existing clients and accounts through the completion of the sale and efficiently respond to all inquiries made by potential clients via phone or email
  • Establish and maintain regular contact with clients and accounts in order to introduce and promote a destination or tour in accordance with company goals, marketing initiatives and sales expectations
  • Identify potential prospects to solicit new business and create a strong pipeline of future business leads
  • Develop a robust sales funnel of leads and prospects to achieve or exceed established sales goals
  • Ensure established monthly and seasonal sales goals are met or exceeded through self-motivation and determination
  • Maintain a detailed, organised and thorough database of teachers, including unqualified, qualified and active leads
  • Ensure CRM is up-to-date at all times
  • Manage and take responsibility for the entire sales process. Work with teachers to set enrolment deadlines for students, helps develop marketing strategies for the teachers to utilise while enrolling students. \xa0
  • Actively seek to develop and improve skills to build performance. Educate yourself on all related tours and WorldStrides products
  • Research and understand the educational travel industry and develop strategies to win business

\xa0

Additional Responsibilities:


  • Identify regional trends, competitive behaviour, promotional effectiveness, and market intelligence
  • Represent WorldStrides at trade association meetings and other related business events to promote all products and services.
  • Coordinates with department Director with the initiation of new marketing ideas and product development ideas


Requirements

  • A bachelor degree
  • 2-3 years progressive sales experience focusing on new business acquisition
  • Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales quotas and measurable performance goals
  • Strong communication and presentation skills including the ability to work with all levels of employees and clients in a diplomatic and professional manner
  • The ability to build strong relationships externally and internally
  • The ability to deal with objections
  • Highly self-driven and motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and the technical aptitude to master our CRM
  • Ability to multi-task projects and responsibilities and have strong prioritisation skills

\xa0

If this is the sales role you have been looking for, come make your mark on a growing and dynamic company. Qualified candidates should submit their cover letter and CV through LinkedIn.
